title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Vipul Organics raises ₹35.23 Cr via preferential allotment
items.summary:
- Vipul Organics raised *₹35.23 crore* by issuing 16,70,000 fully paid equity shares at **₹211** each (face value ₹10) through a preferential allotment.
- Nineteen non‑promoter investors participated, and the proceeds will fund **manufacturing capacity expansion** and new product ventures while keeping the company debt‑free.
- The company is expanding into *membrane technology* to broaden its specialty chemicals portfolio and support sustainability goals.

items.title: Godrej delivers heaviest Ecolaire condenser to US power plant
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Godrej delivered its heaviest *Ecolaire Surface Condenser* (~**450 t**) to a US natural-gas power project, partly configured for *hydrogen*.
- Made at its GreenCo-certified *Dahej* plant after a ₹200 crore upgrade, the order highlights India’s role in global engineering (≈70% revenue abroad).
- The delivery strengthens Godrej’s push into *clean energy*—green/blue hydrogen, geothermal and carbon capture—demonstrating capacity for complex large-scale projects.

items.title: Avantel opens ₹56 crore Hyderabad facility to boost indigenous aerospace, defence R&D
FMCG firms witness trade disruption in September, hopeful of growth in second half of FY26
India boosts defence self-reliance with ₹1.2L crore push
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- India's domestic defence procurements rose from ₹74,000 crore (2021–22) to about ₹1,20,000 crore by 2024–25, reflecting a policy shift toward *indigenous* design and manufacturing.
- Defence Minister Rajnath Singh emphasized preparing for *non‑contact warfare*—drones, anti‑drone systems and air defence—by prioritizing technology-oriented capabilities.
- The government aims for high *self‑reliance*, to become a prominent *defence exporter*, and to develop niche technologies to support India’s 2047 ambitions.

items.title: PEDA inks pact with IISC for green hydrogen production
items.summary:
- *PEDA* signed an MoU with *IISc* to pilot **green hydrogen** production from *paddy straw* in Punjab.
- The project targets *stubble burning* reduction, improved *air quality*, and new revenue and jobs for farmers.
- It will test technical and commercial viability and support India's *National Green Hydrogen Mission* for wider rollout.

items.title: Tamil Nadu CM opens Space & Defence Industries Exhibition
items.author: ANI
items.summary:
- Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin inaugurated the *Space and Defence Industries Exhibition* in Chennai, framing the state as a rising hub for **manufacturing** and the *space sector*.  
- He highlighted Tamil Nadu's 9.69% economic growth for 2024–25, announced a 20% bonus and ex-gratia for *C and D category* public sector workers, and noted measures supporting women's workforce participation.  
- The exhibition seeks to attract investment and strengthen industry linkages, signaling sustained state support for **space and defence** manufacturing.

items.title: US lawmakers raise alarm over China’s $40 billion chip equipment purchases amid regulatory loopholes
Philippines manufacturing output rises 2% on food production
items.summary:
- The Philippines' manufacturing *VaPI* rose **2% year-on-year** in August, while *VoPI* increased **1.4%**, reversing July's declines.
- Growth was largely driven by the *manufacture of food products* (contributing **46.3%**), with support from basic metals and machinery sectors.
- Meanwhile, national inflation edged up to **1.7%** in September (core inflation **2.6%**), adding macro context to the recovery.

items.title: New satellite plant in Italy to boost production
items.summary:
- A 21,000 sqm *Space Smart* factory near Rome, financed (€100M) by EU post‑COVID funds and Thales Alenia Space, will begin operations this year to produce about **100 satellites a year**.
- The plant will support *civil and defence* applications, bring together ~150 SMEs, and play a central role in Italy's planned national low‑orbit dual‑use constellation of over 100 satellites.
- Leonardo and Thales (TAS) aim to boost European competitiveness vs *SpaceX/China/US* and are in talks with **Airbus** to form a major new European satellite manufacturer.

items.title: JLR resumes phased production after cyber incident; launches supplier financing scheme
iCreate launches drone challenge 2025 to propel India's drone innovation landscape
Turkish Airlines faces two-year delay in engine repairs, grounding 45 Airbus jets
EU plans major steel tariff increase to protect industry from Chinese competition
Corning eyes bigger pie of India’s auto market, plans to double footprint
Tessolve joins eSync alliance to boost connected vehicle software solutions
GPS Renewables appoints Parag Parikh as CEO of GPSR Arya
TKIL targets green hydrogen leadership with phased localisation and export push
Gold prices hit record high amid global uncertainty as silver follows suit
Chinese semiconductor companies line up their chips to match US giants
National conference on defence manufacturing starts in Delhi today
Solar and wind power has grown faster than electricity demand this year, report says
China to add two-thirds of global offshore wind capacity by 2025: Report
Tata Chemicals partners with Monash University Malaysia for gastroenterology research
Clean energy push: EESL, APEPDCL plan solar, EV projects in coastal AP
Govt to decide on Baldota steel mill after courts: CM
items.author: ET Bureau
items.summary:
- CM Siddaramaiah said the government will decide on the proposed *Baldota* **10.5 MTPA** steel plant in *Koppal* only after court rulings.
- The *₹54,000 crore* greenfield project — cleared by central and state authorities and touted to create about *15,000 jobs* — has halted amid local protests and a CM directive to stop work.
- Baldota has acquired 1,000 acres and plans another 2,400 acres; pending legal cases and community opposition will determine the project's outcome.

items.title: AMD signs AI chip-supply deal with OpenAI, gives it option to take a 10% stake
US FCC to vote to tighten restrictions on Chinese equipment
Qualcomm fights $647 million UK lawsuit over smartphone chip royalties
The Economic Times to organise Global Manufacturing Conclave 2025 in Gurugram
Geon & Auto Sales India expand green energy in Northeast
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Geon* has partnered with *Auto Sales India* to distribute **EV** and inverter battery solutions across the eight states of *Northeast India*.  
- The collaboration leverages Geon’s technology with Auto Sales’ service and distribution network to target electric three‑wheelers and solar/grid inverter markets.  
- The aim is to improve reliable power access for vehicles, homes and businesses and to expand *green energy* adoption in the region.

items.title: Kranti Industries, Kores Group form JV for precision machining
items.summary:
- Kranti Industries and Kores Group launched *KRAKO Precision*, a 35:65 joint venture to build a greenfield **precision machining** facility in Halol, Gujarat for critical casting components.
- The plant will use advanced *CNC* and automation systems and primarily serve Kores Group’s casting needs while pursuing wider *automotive* and engineering contracts.
- The JV expands Kranti’s footprint in western India, improving access to OEM clusters and logistics for *high-precision* component supply.

items.title: Sampre Nutritions to raise ₹355 crore via FCCBs
items.summary:
- The board approved issuance of *USD 40 million* (≈ **₹355.06 crore**) in FCCBs, comprising 400 bonds of *$100,000* each.
- Proceeds will fund international expansion targeting *Egypt* and *Liberia (Monrovia)* to broaden the company's global footprint and diversify revenue.
- Sampre also signed MOUs with potential revenue up to **₹45 crore** for manufacturing and supplying nutraceutical and food products.

items.title: Geopolitical fragmentation to slow energy demand
items.author: Sanjeev Choudhary, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- BP chief economist Spencer Dale warns rising *geopolitical fragmentation* will curb *global trade* and slow *energy demand* as nations prioritise self-reliance.
- For India, which imports ~90% of oil and ~50% of gas, the Outlook says policymakers will cut oil and gas use, boost domestic production, electrify processes, and lean more on *coal* and *renewables*.
- The report forecasts divergent shifts: the *US* may see fossil fuels regain share while *China* boosts coal and renewables at the expense of imported oil and gas.

items.title: PVV Infra bags ₹799 crore solar power orders in Uttar Pradesh
items.author: ETEnergyWorld Desk
items.summary:
- PVV Infra Ltd won two solar orders worth *₹799 crore* in *Uttar Pradesh*: a 100 MW project (PVV EVTech) under a 25‑year PPA with UPNEDA, valued ~*₹384 crore* and expected to generate ~*₹53 crore* annually.
- PVV Housing secured an *EPC* contract for a 109 MW project valued ~*₹415 crore*; both projects in Baghpat and Moradabad are partnered with *Nacof Oorja*.
- The Board approved using *Special Purpose Vehicles* to scale its *renewable energy* footprint across *power development* and *EPC operations*.

items.title: Milrem, DeltaQuad & Tulip sign production deal at VDL Born
items.summary:
- Estonian firm *Milrem Robotics* and Dutch drone makers *DeltaQuad* and *Tulip Tech* have secured factory space at *VDL*'s Born facility to produce unmanned ground vehicles, drones and battery-enhancing technologies.
- The site is expected to host hundreds of workers and fulfil orders for the *Dutch* and *Ukrainian* militaries, though exact production details are being kept sensitive for security and commercial reasons.
- *VDL* — which produced BMW cars at Born until March 2024 — still has significant unused space and a 'pipeline' of other firms exploring military production at the plant.

items.title: How AI and trade reform can drive India's next economic growth
items.summary:
- World Bank economist Franziska Ohnsorge says *AI* and *trade liberalisation* can boost *services exports* (computer services exports rose ~30% since ChatGPT) and attract investment, potentially igniting a **manufacturing revival**.
- She warns India’s goods exports lag due to high tariffs on intermediate inputs and low *FDI*, so tariff cuts and broader trade agreements are needed to restore competitiveness.
- Addressing low female *labour force participation*—limited by conservative norms, safety, and access to export-oriented services—could further expand India’s growth potential.

items.title: Greta Minerals doubles exploration landholding in Western Australia, eyes Lithium supply for India
Carlyle seen as front-runner for BASF coatings sale
items.summary:
- Private equity firm *Carlyle* is the front‑runner to buy **BASF**'s coatings unit in a deal valuing the business at about **€7 billion**.
- The division, which produces mainly automotive coatings, has over *10,300 employees* and posted roughly **€3.8 billion** in sales last year.
- BASF began exploring strategic options earlier this year, expects a decision in Q4, and said proceeds could accelerate a planned **€4 billion** share buyback for 2027–28.

items.title: Deepak Group launches next-gen R&D centre
items.summary:
- Deepak Nitrite opened *DRDC 2.0*, a 5-acre, next‑gen R&D centre with advanced laboratories, analytical facilities, piloting, polymer and engineering units.  
- The centre, staffed by *100+ professionals including PhDs*, will run largely on solar power and focus on sustainable chemicals, petrochemicals and advanced materials.  
- Leadership says DRDC aims to accelerate innovation, support *Make in India*, and scale new products and processes for global markets.

items.title: SAIL supplies special-grade indigenous steel for Indian Navy
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- SAIL supplied the *entire* special-grade steel—including HR sheets and plates—for INS Androth and all eight *ASW‑SWC* corvettes built by GRSE.
- The steel was produced at SAIL’s Bokaro, Bhilai and Rourkela plants, complementing earlier deliveries such as 8,000 tonnes for frigates INS Udaygiri and INS Himgiri.
- By enabling *import substitution* and supporting *Atmanirbhar Bharat*—with Rourkela’s Special Plate Plant supplying over 100,000 tonnes—SAIL strengthens India’s indigenous defence manufacturing and naval modernization.

items.title: India's trade strategy risks lagging without China focus
items.summary:
- NITI Aayog CEO B.V.R. Subrahmanyam warns India's trade strategy could *lag* unless it expands exports to *China* and lowers *import tariffs* on raw materials.  
- The Trade Watch report says exports to China fell 7% to $15.1bn in 2024 while imports rose to $109.4bn, and flags weak *leather* and *footwear* sectors harmed by high input duties.  
- It recommends cutting duties on key inputs to boost *manufacturing exports* and regain competitiveness versus rivals like Vietnam and Italy.

items.title: India may need US soybean meal imports as poultry sector grows: CLFMA chief
NMM reduces import risks in India's clean energy push
items.summary:
- The *National Manufacturing Mission (NMM)* aims to secure supply chains for India's clean energy transition by reducing *import dependency* (estimated 20–90% for key components).  
- ICRA warns that without domestic scaling nearly *70% of capital investment* to meet 2030 targets could flow abroad; the NMM has 10% of its outlay in Budget 2025‑26 and 500+ *MSMEs/startups* onboarded.  
- Effective execution could *cut imports*, create cleantech jobs, and position India as a global *clean technology* exporter.

items.title: Eli Lilly to invest $1B in Telangana pharma plant
items.summary:
- Eli Lilly will invest *over $1 billion* to build a manufacturing plant and quality centre in Hyderabad to expand production of medicines for *diabetes, obesity, cancer, Alzheimer’s*, and autoimmune conditions.
- The investment is expected to create *thousands of jobs*, with immediate recruitment across engineering, chemistry, analytical sciences, quality assurance, and management, reinforcing Hyderabad as a global *life sciences* hub.
- Telangana has pledged full government support and highlighted local initiatives like the Advanced Technology Centre at *Genome Valley* and the new *Global Capability Centre* to attract further pharma investment.

items.title: Nayab Singh Saini in Japan to attract investments, deepen cooperation in technology, manufacturing
Jyoti Global Plast forays into drone manufacturing with launch of surveillance model
Rolls-Royce appoints Sashi Mukundan as Executive VP, Transformation India
Flytta unveils retrofitted 13-tonne electric truck
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Flytta launched India’s first retrofitted *13‑tonne* electric truck for cement transport, developed with **Kalyani Powertrain** and deployed with **Dalmia Cement** on the Yadwad–Goa corridor.
- The firm began operations and plans about *200* retrofitted trucks, expanding a medium‑to‑heavy duty platform offering 13–40t payloads for cement, steel, coal and minerals.
- Executives call this a step toward *green logistics* but urge stronger EV charging infrastructure and policy support to scale decarbonisation.

items.title: GlobalLogic, IRClass Systems form AI partnership for industrial sectors
